owner-id.description: The user who is assigned to the object
owner-id.title: Owner ID

associated-contact-ids.description: Contact IDs associated with the object
associated-contact-ids.title: Associated Contact IDs

items.title: Associated Contact ID
items.description: Contact ID associated with the object

create-contacts-association.description: Existing contact IDs to be associated with the object
create-contacts-association.title: Create Object -> Contact Association using contact IDs

create-deals-association.description: Existing deal IDs to be associated with the object
create-deals-association.title: Create Object -> Deal Association using deal IDs

create-companies-association.description: Existing company IDs to be associated with the object
create-companies-association.title: Create Object -> Company Association using company IDs

create-tickets-association.description: Existing ticket IDs to be associated with the object
create-tickets-association.title: Create Object -> Ticket Association using ticket IDs

phone-number.description: Phone number. If you plan to use the number formatting feature in HubSpot, use country code + phone number. Example: +886xxxxxxxxx
phone-number.title: Phone Number

lifecycle-stage.description: Lifecycle stages are used to track how contacts or companies move forward in your process. Default format is in small letters, all words are combined. Example: salesqualifiedlead. However, remember to check internal value for custom fields.
lifecycle-stage.title: Lifecycle Stage

lead-status.description: The contact's sales, prospecting or outreach status. Default format is in capital letters, with _ as space. Example: IN_PROGRESS. However, remember to check internal value for custom fields.
lead-status.title: Lead Status

pipeline.description: A pipeline is the place where you document and manage how your prospects move through the steps of your sales process. HubSpot uses interval value rather than the name displayed in the view
pipeline.title: Pipeline

deal-stage.description: Deal stages allow you to categorize and track the progress of the deals that you are working on. Default format is in small letters, all words are combined. Example: qualifiedtobuy. However, remember to check internal value for custom fields.
deal-stage.title: Deal Stage

amount.description: The total amount of the deal
amount.title: Amount

deal-type.description: The type of deal. Default format is in small letters, all words are combined. Example: newbusiness. However, remember to check internal value for custom fields.
deal-type.title: Deal Type

close-date.description: Date the deal was closed. Set automatically by HubSpot. Format is in ISO 8601. Example: 2024-07-01T11:47:40.388Z
close-date.title: Close Date

create-date.description: Create date. Format is in ISO 8601. Example: 2024-07-01T11:47:40.388Z
create-date.title: Create Date

company-domain.description: The domain name of the company
company-domain.title: Company Domain

phone-number.description: Phone number of the company. If you plan to use the number formatting feature in HubSpot, use country code + phone number. Example: +886xxxxxxxxx
phone-number.title: Phone Number

industry.description: The industry the company belongs to. Default format is in capital letters, with _ as space. Example: BROADCAST_MEDIA
industry.title: Industry

company-type.description: Type of company. Default format is capital letter. Example: RESELLER
company-type.title: Company Type

total-revenue.description: Total revenue. Calculated automatically by HubSpot
total-revenue.title: Total Revenue

ticket-status.description: The pipeline stage that contains this ticket. Default format is number. Example: 1. However, remember to check internal value for custom fields. Note: In Instill AI, ticket-status is displayed as string because of the possible custom internal value.
ticket-status.title: Ticket Status

pipeline.description: A pipeline organizes and tracks the progression of tickets through various stages of resolution within your support process. HubSpot uses interval value rather than the name displayed in the view
pipeline.title: Pipeline

categories.description: The main reason customer reached out for help. Default format is in capital letters. Example: BILLING_ISSUE. However, remember to check internal value for custom fields.
categories.title: Categories

priority.description: The level of attention needed on the ticket. Default format is in capital letters. Example: MEDIUM. However, remember to check internal value for custom fields.
priority.title: Priority

source.description: Channel where ticket was originally submitted. Default format is in capital letters. Example: EMAIL
source.title: Source

create-date.description: Create date. Format is in ISO 8601. Example: 2024-07-01T11:47:40.388Z
create-date.title: Create Date

last-modified-date.description: Last modified date. Format is in ISO 8601. Example: 2024-07-01T11:47:40.388Z
last-modified-date.title: Last Modified Date

TASK_GET_CONTACT.instillShortDescription: Get contact information using contact ID or Email

contact-id-or-email.description: Input contact ID or email. If the input has @, it will search the contact using email
contact-id-or-email.title: Contact ID or Email

TASK_GET_DEAL.instillShortDescription: Get deal information using deal ID

output.description: Obtain user ID that updated the deal and its update time.

updated-by-user-id.description: User ID that updated the deal
updated-by-user-id.title: Updated By User ID

updated-at.description: The time when the deal was updated
updated-at.title: Updated At

output.title: Output

TASK_GET_COMPANY.instillShortDescription: Get company information using company ID

TASK_GET_TICKET.instillShortDescription: Get ticket information using ticket ID

updated-at.description: The time when the ticket was updated
updated-at.title: Updated At

TASK_GET_THREAD.instillShortDescription: Retrieve all the messages inside a thread (conversation inbox). The messages will be sorted from most recent to least recent. Note: This task uses Conversation API from HubSpot, which is still in BETA.

sender-type.description: Specify the category of sender information
sender-type.title: Type

sender-value.description: Contains the actual sender information (e.g.: email address)
sender-value.title: Value

sender-actor-id.description: The actor ID of the sender
sender-actor-id.title: Actor ID

type.description: Specify the category of recipient information
type.title: Type

value.description: Contains the actual recipient information (e.g.: email address)
value.title: Value

channel-id.description: The ID of a generic channel returned from the channels endpoint, like 1000 for live chat, 1001 for Facebook Messenger, 1002 for email, etc.
channel-id.title: Channel ID

channel-account-id.description: The ID of an account that is part of the channel-id channel.
channel-account-id.title: Channel Account ID

no-of-messages.description: The number of messages in a thread
no-of-messages.title: Number of Messages

TASK_INSERT_MESSAGE.instillShortDescription: Insert message into a thread (only support email thread)

sender-actor-id.description: Input sender actor id. Example: A-12345678. To obtain this, it is recommended to use and copy the 'Get Thread task' sender output. For [more information](https://developers.hubspot.com/beta-docs/guides/api/conversations/inbox-and-messages#get-actors) about actor id
sender-actor-id.title: Sender Actor ID

channel-account-id.description: The ID of an account that is part of the channel-id channel. On an existing thread, it is recommended to copy channel-account-id of the most recent message on the thread.
channel-account-id.title: Channel Account ID

TASK_RETRIEVE_ASSOCIATION.instillShortDescription: Get the object IDs associated with contact ID (contact->objects). If you are trying to do the opposite (object->contacts), it is possible using the other tasks. Example: Go to get deal task to obtain deal->contacts. Remember to check that the contact ID you input exists, because there won't be an error message if the contact ID doesn't exist.

input.description: Contact ID and object type (CRM objects or Thread)

object-type.description: Input object type (CRM objects or 'Threads'). Note: CRM objects include 'Deals', 'Companies', 'Tickets', etc
object-type.title: Object Type

input.title: Input

object-ids.description: An array of object ID associated with the contact
object-ids.title: Object ID Array

items.title: Object ID
items.description: The object ID associated with the contact

TASK_GET_OWNER.instillShortDescription: Get information about HubSpot owner using either owner ID or user ID. For more information about owner, please go to [here](https://developers.hubspot.com/docs/api/crm/owners)

id-type.description: Specify the type of ID you will use to get owner's information.
id-type.title: ID Type

id.description: Can either be owner ID or user ID; according to the ID type you selected.
id.title: ID

owner-id.description: Owner ID. Usually used to associate the owner with other objects.
owner-id.title: Owner ID

user-id.description: User ID. Usually used to indicate the owner who performed the action. User ID can be seen in Update Deal task output.
user-id.title: User ID

team-primary.description: Indicate whether this team is the primary team of the owner
team-primary.title: Team Primary

TASK_GET_ALL.instillShortDescription: Get all the IDs for a specific object (e.g. all contact IDs)

object-type.description: The object which you want to get all IDs for
object-type.title: Object Type

output.description: All the IDs of the object
output.title: Output
